column4: got a question too, need to setup a server which mirrors the content of one directory to a secound server in realtime
my first aproch was, creating a cronjob which starts rsync, and run that every 5 min or so
any other ideas for realtime mirroring
i know mirroring is not good, but i my "boss" tells me what to do... i just find a solution :P
tell your boss to make regular backups and use RAID0+1
well i go and have a talk with em on monday
userspace tools to mirror files is asking for epic fail
even using LVM and snapshot features with userspace tools is going to be a hassle to keep 2 copies at a point in time operational
realtime backup what elephant nuts is that
if you want a backup of a file that is in a consistent state, use 'duplicity' command available in repos
getting things into consistent states is not the job of userland
maybe i'm using the wrong word for what i want but ill have a look
well duplicity looks like a good solution for creating backups, ill show it to my boss... what would your aproach be to keep to different servers mirrored
